result.execSummary:
The defendant David Allen Westrich Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact with I.W.N.-dob: 7-05-05 and M.M.N.-dob: 2-15-99

Sexual offender evaluation and treatment.  Submit a DNA sample.  Attend counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  No sexual offender registry.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Undergo an AODA assessment and participate in treatment as recommended.
Obtain GED or HSED at discretion of agent.

timeConds.notes:
Shall commence within 30 days of sentencing.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Consecutive to: Taylor Co. Case No. 16CF13

Motion and Order to Revoke Huber Privileges
DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation
Granting Extension of 30 day to Report
In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing

Defendant David Allen Westrich in court with attorney Shawn M Paul.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  Victim rights complied. DE entered a plea of no contest to amended Counts 1 & 2 of 4th Degree Sexual Assault Wis. Stat. 940.225(3m). Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC. Court ordered a withheld sentence on Ct. 1 and placed DE on probation for 2 years with the following conditions:  $100.00 fine; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA; Sexual offender evaluation and treatment; Counseling as deemed appropriate by probation agent; no contact with I.W.N.-dob: 7-5-05 and M.M.N.-dob: 2-15-99; 4 months in the Taylor County Jail consecutive to 16CF13; must obtain GED or HSED at discretion of agent.  Court ordered a withheld sentence on Ct. 2 and placed DE on probation for 2 years with the following conditions: court costs; sexual offender evaluation and treatment; AODA; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; no contact with I.W.N. dob: 7-5-05 and M.M.N. dob: 2-15-99; must obtain GED or HSED at the discretion of agent.  Court orders DE does not have to do the sexual offender registry. ba

Defendant David Allen Westrich in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of complaint.   Defendant indicated that he will look into getting an attorney.  Court advises defendant of right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits for a preliminary hearing.
